title: UMANG
description:
UMANG (Unified Mobile Application for New-age Governance) is envisaged to make e-governance 'mobile first'. It is developed by Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) and National e-Governance Division (NeGD).
                                                                                                     
It is an evolving platform designed for citizens of India to offer them access to the pan-India e-Gov services from the Central, State, Local Bodies, and Agencies of government on app, web, SMS, and IVR channels.
 
Key Features:
- Unified Platform: It brings together all government departments and their services on a single platform to provide better and easier services to citizens.
- Mobile First Strategy: It aligns all government services with the mobile first strategy to leverage mobile adoption trends.    
- Integration with Digital India Services: It provides seamless integration with other Digital India Services like Aadhaar, DigiLocker, and PayGov. Any new such service will automatically be integrated with the platform.
- Uniform Experience: It is designed to enable citizens to discover, download, access, and use all government services easily.
- Secure and Scalable: It supports Aadhaar-based and other authentication mechanisms for service access. The sensitive profile data is saved in an encrypted format and no one can view this information.               
 
Key Services:
UMANG provides easy access to a plethora of Indian government services ranging from – Healthcare, Finance, Education, Housing, Energy, Agriculture, Transport to even Utility and Employment and Skills.
 
Key Benefits for Citizens:
- Single-Point Ubiquitous Access: All government services are available for citizens on a unified platform for easy access through multiple online and offline channels (SMS, email, app, and web).      
- More for Less: Only a single mobile app needs to be installed instead of each app of each department.
- Convenience: Citizens do not even need to install or update the app again to avail government services if more services are added to the platform.
- Saving of Time and Money: Citizens can anytime and anywhere avail these services through their mobile phones, desktops, and laptops without any need for visiting the department office and standing in queues.
- Uniform Experience: All the government services including payment-based transactions provide secure and uniform experience.

It is an evolving platform designed for citizens of India to offer them access to the pan-India e-Gov services from the Central, State, Local Bodies, and Agencies of government on app, web, SMS, and IVR channels.

summary: Unified Mobile Application for New-age Governance
recentChanges:
- Services are now accessible for guest users.
- Users can now track their application from TransactionHistory.
- Facilitating seamless document discovery, users can effortlessly locate their Digilocker documents grouped by similar types.
comments: App is designed well, things are easy to find, however, Jeevan Praman just shows an error after face recognition or finger scan, and it stops there. The text is jumbled on the popup and everyday it's the same story. Last year it was working fine, now it's wasted effort. It could be a server error but it's there from many days.

This app really has a lot of potential but what ever feature we choose, it crashes and pop up message " something went wrong" comes. Why an app developed by the government is so buggy and useless, we don't understand. I tried nearly 50-60 times for doing basic things in the app but everytime same pop up message comes. Update: Even today I tried in app and also in laptop, it is not loading or showing " something went wrong" Such a pathetic app! Last week I sent mail but no response yet

Such a necessary application get it doesn't function most of the times. 8/10 times that I switch it on, it crashes and automatically switches off. Other times, the OTP doesn't generate for so long. Pages keep refreshing and logging me out automatically while I'm in the application. This application works just like "sarkaari offices", totally unreliable. Please just fix these bugs, they've been continuing for over a year now.

I guess bad connectivity caused the app to crash on opening the first time. The overall interface is quite good and user friendly. However, some of the internal menus need to be updated properly. The auto-detection of OTP does not happen most of the time. I use Truecaller, so I am unsure if that's the issue. Claim process needs to be more guided and intuitive. Response by developers is almost blazing fast! 👍

I think it's bad connectivity because there are lots of bugs and fixes. Lot of times when we open the app it's fine but if when we open other thing in the app so it shows, Department servers are too busy or too load. Try after sometime and it shows for a long time like 3-4 days. After that we can open. I think it needs to upgrade more. Otherwise OTP services are too fast 🤞. Thanks
